prs.Title: Setting search
prs.Author: vanzue
prs.Head: dev/vanzue/search
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->

## AI summary
This pull request introduces infrastructure and code to support search functionality for PowerToys settings, including a new search index specification, a dedicated search library, and updates to the solution configuration. The main changes are the addition of a spec describing how settings should be indexed and navigated, the creation of a new `Common.Search` project with a fuzz search implementation, and updates to the solution file to include these new components.

**Settings Search Feature Implementation**

* Documentation:
  * Added a detailed specification (`settings-search.md`) describing the structure of PowerToys settings pages, how to index settings, navigation logic, runtime search, result grouping, build-time indexing strategy, and corner cases.

* New Search Library:
  * Added the new `Common.Search` project to the solution, including its project file and implementation of a fuzz search service (`FuzzSearchService<T>`), match options, match results, and search precision scoring. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-ddc06fa41e4e723e54181b0cb85cdd00f57f75725d51ceefa242d4d651a9a363R1-R8) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-1a2ca29fc33bcccf338a7843a040ca2c31ba821e8cab7064fab0dbb1224d454cR1-R39) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-242764d948b795f39653a84d9b6bfcdc52730100deab2e3a0995be95bb8e7868R1-R10) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-61e525491ed916ebd65dabb66dd4f5dc720320d7e295ef1e0bd6d506ea0f7df6R1-R67) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-a775f6de2e8d42982829b4161668f49dedbbd9dcbb05ce20003de7e62275c57aR1-R12)

* Solution Configuration:
  * Updated `PowerToys.sln` to include `Common.Search` and `Settings.UI.XamlIndexBuilder` projects, and configured their build settings for various platforms and mapped project dependencies. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-ca837ce490070b91656ffffe31cbad8865ba9174e0f020231f77baf35ff3f811R714-R716) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-ca837ce490070b91656ffffe31cbad8865ba9174e0f020231f77baf35ff3f811R2704-R2727) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-ca837ce490070b91656ffffe31cbad8865ba9174e0f020231f77baf35ff3f811R2889) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-ca837ce490070b91656ffffe31cbad8865ba9174e0f020231f77baf35ff3f811R3157-R3158)

**Spell-check Dictionary Updates**

* Added new terms related to navigation and settings UI components (such as `Navigatable`, `NavigatablePage`, `settingscard`, `Tru`, `tweakable`) to the spell-check dictionary to support the new search and indexing features. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-5dcab162c1b233a49973ae010f2b88c7ec4844382abd705e6154685e62bd5c4dR1020-R1021) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-5dcab162c1b233a49973ae010f2b88c7ec4844382abd705e6154685e62bd5c4dR1498) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-5dcab162c1b233a49973ae010f2b88c7ec4844382abd705e6154685e62bd5c4dR1755-R1761)
prs.AIOverview:
This pull request introduces a comprehensive search feature for PowerToys settings, enabling users to quickly find and navigate to specific settings and modules. The implementation includes a new search index service, dedicated search UI components, and infrastructure for indexing all settings pages and their elements.

- Adds a search index service that indexes all PowerToys modules and their individual settings
- Implements a new search UI with live suggestions and a dedicated search results page  
- Updates all settings pages to use a new `NavigatablePage` base class for search navigation support

prs.Title: [Installer] Upgrade the installer from WiX3 to WiX5
prs.Author: zhaopy536
prs.Head: feature/wix_migration
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request
Background:  The current PowerToys installer is built using Wix3, which has now been deprecated. To improve security, service quality, and community support, weΓÇÖre upgrading the installer to Wix5.

Implementation:
Created Wix5-based projects(PowerToysSetupVext and PowerToysSetupCustomActionsVNext) within the installer while retaining the existing Wix3 project. Both versions are built to generate separate installation packages. The Wix3-related code will be removed after successful release testing confirms no issues.

Special case:
Wix5 has removed the property for 'ShowFilesInUse'. Now, whenever a file is in use during installation, a FilesInUse pop-upwill automatically appear asking for the next step. To ensure this doesn't interfere with scenarios that require silent installation (e.g. Winget method), weΓÇÖve handled it using the bafunction approach.



<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR upgrades the PowerToys installer from WiX3 to WiX5, creating a new installer project (PowerToysSetupVNext) alongside the existing WiX3 project. The upgrade improves security, service quality, and community support while maintaining backward compatibility during the transition.

Key changes include:
- Creation of new WiX5-based installer projects using modern WixToolset.Sdk
- Implementation of a custom BA function to handle "files in use" scenarios for silent installations
- Update of build scripts to target the new WiX5 installer instead of WiX3

prs.Title: CmdPal: Fix winget in release builds
prs.Author: zadjii-msft
prs.Head: dev/migrie/b/winget-experiments
prs.Description: (No Summary section found)
prs.AIOverview:
This PR fixes issues with WinGet functionality in release builds by addressing trim-safety problems with `.ToArray()` calls on `IIterable<>` collections returned by the WinGet API. The fix involves manually iterating over collections instead of using LINQ operations that are not trim-safe.

Key changes:
- Replace `.ToArray()` and LINQ operations with manual iteration loops for WinGet API collections
- Add comprehensive error handling with better logging throughout the WinGet extension
- Improve variable declarations using `var` keyword for better consistency

prs.Title: CmdPal: fix missing builtin icons
prs.Author: zadjii-msft
prs.Head: dev/migrie/b/wasdk-icons-missing
prs.Description: (No Summary section found)
prs.AIOverview:
This PR centralizes common dependencies for CmdPal extensions by introducing a shared Common.ExtDependencies.props file to ensure consistent inclusion of WASDK, WebView2, and the CmdPal toolkit across all built-in extensions. This fixes missing icons by ensuring all extensions properly include the required dependencies.

- Introduces a shared Common.ExtDependencies.props file that includes WASDK, WebView2, and CmdPal toolkit references
- Updates all CmdPal extension project files to import the common dependencies file
- Removes individual project references to the CmdPal toolkit in favor of the centralized approach

prs.AIOverview:
This PR adds accessibility IDs to FancyZones UI elements to improve the reliability of UI tests. The change replaces text-based element selection with accessibility ID-based selection to avoid issues when UI text changes.

- Adds AutomationProperties.AutomationId attributes to FancyZones UI controls
- Implements AutomationId property in LayoutModel that generates IDs based on layout names
- Updates UI tests to use accessibility IDs instead of text for element selection

prs.Title: feat(MouseWithoutBorders): Prevent Easy Mouse from moving to another machine when an application is running in fullscreen mode.
prs.Author: dot-tb
prs.Head: mouse-without-borders/stop-easy-mouse-when-foreground-fullscreen
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

This PR adds a new feature to Easy Mouse, it is now possible to toggle a setting that will prevent Easy Mouse to switch away from the host machine when the foreground application is running in full screen mode, requiring the user to first alt tab out of the application before performing the switch, this also comes with a way to allow the switch on specific apps.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e45bbfa7-89c9-4051-8f1a-f2ac2648a6ca)

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR adds a toggle and exclusion list to prevent Easy Mouse from switching machines when a fullscreen application is active.

- Introduces two new settings: disabling Easy Mouse on fullscreen and a per-app exclusion list.
- Updates ViewModel, UI (XAML), and settings properties to surface the new controls.
- Implements native WinAPI calls to detect fullscreen apps and block switches accordingly.

prs.Title: [QuickAccent] Persist characters usage between runs
prs.Author: davidegiacometti
prs.Head: users/davidegiacometti/quick-accent-freq
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR implements persistence for character usage data in the QuickAccent PowerToy, allowing frequently used characters to maintain their sort order between application runs. The feature saves usage statistics to a JSON file when the "Sort characters by usage frequency" setting is enabled.

- Adds JSON serialization/deserialization for character usage data
- Implements file-based persistence using `%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\PowerToys\QuickAccent\UsageInfo.json`
- Manages usage data lifecycle (save on close, delete when sorting is disabled)

prs.Title: [QuickAccent] Update Topmost logic to attempt to fix hybrid graphics issues
prs.Author: daverayment
prs.Head: patch-4
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

This PR changes the Topmost behaviour for Quick Accent from always true to only being true when the selection window is displayed.

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR addresses a hybrid graphics issue on laptops with Optimus technology where the Quick Accent utility was causing the system to remain locked in discrete graphics mode. The fix changes the Topmost behavior from being permanently enabled on the main application window to being conditionally applied only to the selection window when it's actively displayed.

- Removes permanent Topmost setting from the main application window during initialization
- Dynamically sets Topmost on the selection window only when it becomes active
- Aims to prevent graphics resource retention that may trigger continuous discrete GPU usage

prs.Title: Change PowerRename accelerator key from "W" to "E"
prs.Author: aaron-ni
prs.Head: patch-1
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request
In the Windows Explorer context menu, using "w" as the accelerator key in Po"w"erRename conflicts with the Ne"w" command. This slows down people who have to do things like create new folders frequently (especially because muscle memory leads to PowerRename launching and then having to be closed before going and creating the new folder with a bunch of mouse clicks).

Changing the accelerator key to "e" - Pow"e"rRename - only conflicts with "Refresh", which is less commonly used.

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR changes the PowerRename context menu accelerator key from "W" to "E" to resolve a conflict with the Windows Explorer "New" command accelerator. The change improves user experience by reducing interference between frequently used context menu commands.

- Updates the PowerRename context menu entry accelerator from "w" to "e"

Adds [Maltese latin alphabet symbols](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maltese_language#Alphabet) (─ï, ─í, ─º, ┼╝), [grave accented vowels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grave_accent#Stress) (├á, ├¿, ├¼, ├▓, ├╣) and the Euro (Γé¼) sign [Malta's currency] as a supported language into Quick Accent.

![2025-05-15 22_04_53-PowerToys Settings-Quick Accent-Maltese](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb010b5e-abe3-4cf2-8191-f7ecf551d429)

![Quick-Accent-Maltese-Preview](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/688588a2-34d5-4f3b-bd76-752d952ee7d8)

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
Adds support for the Maltese language in Quick Accent, enabling users to select Maltese and type its unique accented letters.

- Registers "MT" in the view model so Maltese appears in the language dropdown  
- Provides a localized display string for Maltese in the English resource file  
- Extends the core Language enum and default letter mappings to include Maltese accents

prs.Title: CmdPal: Make it easier to add APIs in the future
prs.Author: zadjii-msft
prs.Head: dev/migrie/f/properties-test
prs.Description: (No Summary section found)
prs.AIOverview:
This PR adds infrastructure to make it easier to extend the Command Palette's WinRT APIs in the future by working around limitations in metadata-based marshalling (MBM). The changes introduce a type cache pre-loading mechanism to support non-linear interface extension patterns.

Key changes:
- Added `IExtendedAttributesProvider` and `ICommandProvider2` interfaces to support API extensions
- Implemented type cache pre-loading through stub objects to overcome WinRT MBM limitations
- Added support for custom font families in icon rendering
- Created example implementations demonstrating the new extensibility pattern

prs.Title: refactor: Replace WiX-based registration with conditional runtime registration for Win10 context menu modules
prs.Author: lei9444
prs.Head: leilzh/register
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

## AI Summary
This pull request refactors how shell extension registry keys are managed during installation and uninstallation for several PowerToys modules. The main change is moving registry key cleanup logic for context menu shell extensions (ImageResizer, FileLocksmith, PowerRename, NewPlus) from static installer definitions to new custom uninstall actions, ensuring more reliable removal and future extensibility.

**Installer and Uninstall Refactoring**

* Added new custom actions (`CleanImageResizerRuntimeRegistryCA`, `CleanFileLocksmithRuntimeRegistryCA`, `CleanPowerRenameRuntimeRegistryCA`, `CleanNewPlusRuntimeRegistryCA`) to programmatically clean up registry keys for each shell extension during uninstall, implemented in `CustomAction.cpp` and exported in `CustomAction.def`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-c502a81cdf8afa7a38f0f462709abcdbdfcc44beaa6227a1e64a26566c7e8876R1156-R1262) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f941d599be5fe41667eda00338af694c0f2e65709d497a66487402f13e408200R31-R34)
* Registered these custom actions in `Product.wxs` and ensured they run before file removal during uninstall. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-668b4388b55bb934d7ceccbfdd172f69257c9c607ca19cb9752d4a4940b69886R179-R190) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-668b4388b55bb934d7ceccbfdd172f69257c9c607ca19cb9752d4a4940b69886R454-R482)

**Removal of Static Registry Key Definitions**

* Removed static registry key and component definitions for context menu shell extensions from their respective installer `.wxs` files (`FileLocksmith.wxs`, `ImageResizer.wxs`, `PowerRename.wxs`, `NewPlus.wxs`), relying on custom actions for cleanup instead. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7cf9797f8cb6609049763b3b830f6c4a7a02ba5705eb090f7e06fb9c270ca74fL17-L31) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7cf9797f8cb6609049763b3b830f6c4a7a02ba5705eb090f7e06fb9c270ca74fL41) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-c6d00805ce9de0eb3f4d42874dccac17be62f36c35d57e8f863b928b5f955d3aL19-L83) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-c6d00805ce9de0eb3f4d42874dccac17be62f36c35d57e8f863b928b5f955d3aL93) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-d0d69eff3f2d7982679465972b7d3c46dd8006314fb28f0e3a2371e2d5ccedb0L21-L33) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-d0d69eff3f2d7982679465972b7d3c46dd8006314fb28f0e3a2371e2d5ccedb0L43) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-4fd109f66b896577cad2860a829617ca902b33551afaaa8840372035ade2d3f3L17-L32) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-4fd109f66b896577cad2860a829617ca902b33551afaaa8840372035ade2d3f3L42)

**Project File Update**

* Added `shell_ext_registration.h` to the solution file, possibly for future shell extension registration logic.

These changes improve uninstall reliability and centralize registry cleanup logic, making future maintenance and extension of shell extension registration much simpler.
prs.AIOverview:
This PR refactors PowerToys' shell extension registration from static WiX-based installer registration to conditional runtime registration for Win10 context menu modules. This change addresses issues where DLLs load even when modules are disabled and prevents cross-OS conflicts (Win11 loading Win10 extensions).

- Replaces static WiX installer shell extension registration with runtime registration during module startup
- Implements conditional registration logic based on Windows version (Win11 uses MSIX packages, Win10 uses runtime registration)
- Adds cleanup custom actions to the installer to remove residual registry entries during uninstallation

prs.Title: CmdPal: Prevent some SearchText bouncing.
prs.Author: zadjii-msft
prs.Head: dev/migrie/b/38190-bouncing-searchtext
prs.Description: (No Summary section found)
prs.AIOverview:
This PR fixes a race condition in the Command Palette extension SDK that was causing search text to "jiggle" or bounce during rapid updates. The issue occurred when `DynamicListPage` would raise `PropChanged(SearchText)` events in response to its own property sets, leading to out-of-order event handling between CmdPal and extensions.

- Introduces a new `SetSearchNoUpdate()` method to update search text without triggering property change events
- Modifies `DynamicListPage.SearchText` setter to use the new method instead of the base setter

prs.Title: Implement "Gliding cursor" accessibility feature
prs.Author: mikehall-ms
prs.Head: flowpointer
prs.Description: ## Summary of the Pull Request Added '[Gliding Cursor](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/37097)' functionality to Mouse Pointer Crosshairs, this enables a single hotkey/Microsoft Adaptive Hub + button to control cursor movement and clicking. This is implemented as an extension to the existing Mouse Pointer Crosshairs module. Testing has been manual, ensuring that the existing Mouse Pointer Crosshairs functionality is unchanged, and that the new Gliding Cursor functionality works alongside Mouse Pointer Crosshairs. ![FlowPointer2](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ede40fe5-d749-45d1-bd8d-627dda2927a3) To test this functionality: - Open Mouse Crosshair settings and make sure the feature is enabled. - Press the shortcut to start the gliding cursor ΓÇö a vertical line appears. - Press the shortcut again to slow the vertical line. - Press once more to fix the vertical line; a horizontal line begins moving. - Press again to slow the horizontal line. - When the lines meet at your target, press the shortcut to perform the click.
prs.AIOverview:
This PR implements a "Gliding cursor" accessibility feature that extends the existing Mouse Pointer Crosshairs functionality. The feature enables single-button cursor control through guided horizontal and vertical lines, making it easier for users with motor disabilities to precisely position and click the mouse cursor.

Key changes:
- Adds a new hotkey and settings for gliding cursor functionality with configurable speed controls
- Implements a state machine with timer-based cursor movement across horizontal and vertical phases
- Extends the existing crosshairs module to support external cursor positioning control

prs.Title: Adding app icon to run context menu item in all apps ext
prs.Author: michaeljolley

prs.Description: (No Summary section found)
prs.AIOverview:
This PR adds cancellation support to the `FetchItems` method in `ListViewModel` to prevent race conditions when multiple fetch operations are triggered. The implementation introduces a dedicated `CancellationTokenSource` for fetch operations that cancels any ongoing fetch when a new one begins.

- Adds a new `_fetchItemsCancellationTokenSource` field to manage fetch operation cancellation
- Implements cancellation checks at key points throughout the `FetchItems` method
- Updates the `Dispose` and `UnsafeCleanup` methods to properly clean up the new cancellation token

prs.Title: CmdPal: Add local keyboard listener and use it to handle GoBack key
prs.Author: jiripolasek
prs.Head: feature/41011-handle-goback-command
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

Listener registers a hook on WH_KEYBOARD and raises an event when a key is pressed down. Main window then uses it to handle the GoBack key that we can't reach any other way.


<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
Adds a local keyboard listener for CmdPal to handle the GoBack key that cannot be captured through standard WinUI input handling. This enables the application to respond to hardware back button presses from users.

- Implements a Windows keyboard hook using WH_KEYBOARD to monitor local key events
- Integrates the listener into MainWindow to handle GoBack key specifically
- Adds proper disposal pattern to prevent resource leaks

prs.AIOverview:
This PR adds a new "No leading spaces" option to the Hosts File Editor that prevents prepending spaces to active lines when saving the hosts file. The feature is disabled by default to maintain backward compatibility with the current formatting behavior.

Key changes:
- Added a new toggle setting "No leading spaces" to prevent indentation of active host entries when disabled entries are present
- Updated the host file writing logic to conditionally apply indentation based on the new setting
- Added comprehensive test coverage for the new functionality

prs.Title: CmdPal: Honor "Single-click activation" only for pointer clicks and not for keyboard
prs.Author: jiripolasek
prs.Head: feature/41101-cmdpal-enter-space-activation
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request

Changes the behavior of keyboard item activation when the item list view has focus.
Previously, the list view handled item activation according to the "Single-click activation" setting regardless of the input source (mouse, pen, touch, or keyboard).

Now, when handling a ListView item click, the input source is detected, and the "Single-click activation" setting is applied only for pointer-raised clicks. For keyboard-triggered clicks, items are always activated immediately.

Since the event `ListView.ItemClick` doesn't provide information about what caused the item activation, this PR work around that by observing last user input on the list immediately before `ItemClick` event is invoked.

Example:

```

  Source:     WinRT.Runtime
  Time:       2025-08-07 15:54:20.4189499
  HRESULT:    0x80131509 (-2146233079)

Stack Trace:
   at WinRT.ExceptionHelpers.<ThrowExceptionForHR>g__Throw|38_0(Int32 hr)
   at ABI.Microsoft.CommandPalette.Extensions.IListPageMethods.GetItems(IObjectReference _obj)
   at Microsoft.CmdPal.Core.ViewModels.ListViewModel.FetchItems()
   at Microsoft.CmdPal.Core.ViewModels.ListViewModel.InitializeProperties()
   at Microsoft.CmdPal.Core.ViewModels.PageViewModel.InitializeAsync()

------------------ Full Exception Details ------------------
System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80131509)
   at WinRT.ExceptionHelpers.<ThrowExceptionForHR>g__Throw|38_0(Int32 hr)
   at ABI.Microsoft.CommandPalette.Extensions.IListPageMethods.GetItems(IObjectReference _obj)
   at Microsoft.CmdPal.Core.ViewModels.ListViewModel.FetchItems()
   at Microsoft.CmdPal.Core.ViewModels.ListViewModel.InitializeProperties()

Γä╣∩╕Å If you need further assistance, please include this information in your support request.

============================================================

```

prs.Title: CmdPal: Null pattern matching based on `is` expression rather than overridable operators
prs.Author: michaeljolley
prs.Head: dev/mjolley/is-not-null
prs.Description: (No Summary section found)
prs.AIOverview:
This PR modernizes null checking patterns across the Command Palette codebase by replacing `== null` and `!= null` operators with the `is null` and `is not null` pattern matching expressions. This change provides stronger guarantees against user-overloaded equality operators and aligns with modern C# best practices.

- Replaces all instances of `!= null` with `is not null` for non-null checks
- Replaces all instances of `== null` with `is null` for null checks  
- Ensures null checking uses identity comparison rather than potentially overridden equality operators

prs.Title: Fix: Move ImageResizer satellite resource dlls under WinUI3Apps<culture>
prs.Author: lei9444
prs.Head: leilzh/local
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request
### Root cause:
Problem Previously the installer installed ImageResizer satellite assemblies into [INSTALLFOLDER]<culture>*.dll. The runtime probes WinUI3Apps<culture>\ for WinUI3 app resource assemblies, so localization failed.

### Fix:
Updated Resources.wxs: ImageResizer_$(var.IdSafeLanguage)_Component now targets Directory="Resource$(var.IdSafeLanguage)WinUI3AppsInstallFolder".

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->

## AI Summary
This pull request updates the installer configuration in `Resources.wxs` to support resource management for WinUI 3 apps. The main changes ensure that resource directories and uninstall logic properly handle the new `WinUI3AppsInstallFolder`, and update the component registration for localized resources.

**Installer resource management updates:**

* Added `WinUI3AppsInstallFolder` to the list of parent directories for resource file generation, ensuring resources for WinUI 3 apps are included during installer builds.

**Component and uninstall logic updates:**

* Updated the `ImageResizer` component to register its resources under `Resource$(var.IdSafeLanguage)WinUI3AppsInstallFolder` instead of the default install folder, aligning with the new directory structure for WinUI 3 apps.
* Added uninstall logic to remove the localized resource folder for `WinUI3AppsInstallFolder`, ensuring cleanup of WinUI 3 app resources during uninstall.
prs.AIOverview:
This PR fixes a localization issue with the ImageResizer component by correcting the installation path for satellite resource DLLs. The WinUI3 runtime probes for resource assemblies in the WinUI3Apps<culture>\ directory, but the installer was placing ImageResizer satellite assemblies in the wrong location.

Key changes:
- Updated the ImageResizer component directory target from INSTALLFOLDER to WinUI3AppsInstallFolder
- Added WinUI3AppsInstallFolder to the list of parent directories for resource directories
- Added proper cleanup for the new WinUI3Apps resource folder during uninstall

## Summary of the Pull Request

Love that we have now environment variables expanding! ≡ƒÜÇ 
Porting also few small features I implemented in Run Folder plugin a long time ago and I love:
- https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/pull/7711
- https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/pull/9579

Threat `~` as user home directory `%USERPROFILE%`

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR adds support for special path prefixes in the command palette's shell extension, allowing users to search paths starting with `~` (home directory), `/` or `\` (system root directory). The implementation expands these shortcuts to their full paths during query processing.

- Extracts environment variable expansion logic into a reusable `Expand` method
- Adds support for `~` prefix to expand to user's home directory
- Adds support for `/` and `\` prefixes to expand to system drive root (typically C:\)

prs.Title: Initial draft for 0.93 release note
prs.Author: yeelam-gordon
prs.Head: user/yeelam/94ReleaseNote
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request


## AI Summary
This pull request updates the `README.md` to document the 0.93 (August 2025) release of Microsoft PowerToys. It introduces a new, modern settings dashboard, details major improvements and new features across multiple modules, and updates installation links and documentation. The release focuses on enhanced user experience, accessibility, performance, stability, and test coverage.

Most important changes:

**Release and Installation Updates**
- Updated all installer links and release references from version 0.92.1 to 0.93.0, and milestone tracking for the next release to 0.94.
- Updated the release highlights and version number to reflect the 0.93 (August 2025) release, with a summary of new features and improvements.

**Settings and User Experience**
- Introduced a completely redesigned, card-based settings dashboard with clearer descriptions, faster navigation, and improved release notes formatting for a better user experience.
- Rewrote setting descriptions for clarity and consistency, added deep link support to specific settings pages, and fixed various UI/UX issues in the settings module.

**Command Palette and Extensions**
- Resolved over 99 issues in Command Palette, including accessibility improvements, context menu enhancements, new navigation shortcuts, AOT compilation mode (reducing install size and memory usage), and re-enabled Clipboard History.
- Added new settings and features to Command Palette extensions, such as command history in Run, improved Apps extension handling, and new context menu options.

**Module Improvements and New Features**
- Mouse Utilities: Added a new spotlight highlighting mode for presentations.
- Peek: Added instant previews and embedded thumbnail support for Binary G-code (.bgcode) 3D printing files.
- Quick Accent: Added Vietnamese language support.

**Development, Testing, and Documentation**
- Upgraded .NET libraries and spell check system, improved CI pipelines, reduced test timeouts, and added over 600 new unit tests (mainly for Command Palette), doubling UI automation coverage.
- Added detailed developer documentation, fixed broken SDK links, and documented new community plugins.

Other minor changes:
- Standardized naming, improved spelling, and cleaned up configuration files for smoother development.
- Minor capitalization fix for "Mouse Utilities" in the utilities table.
prs.AIOverview:
This pull request updates the PowerToys README.md to prepare release notes for version 0.94, transitioning from the current 0.92/0.93 release information to prepare for the upcoming 0.94 release.

- Updates all version references from 0.92.1 to 0.93.0 for download links and installation files
- Replaces the 0.92 release notes section with comprehensive 0.93 release notes
- Updates milestone references to point to 0.94 for next release planning

prs.Title: Mouse highlighter spotlight mode, fix the gpu perf issue
prs.Author: vanzue
prs.Head: dev/vanzue/spotlight-perf
prs.Description:
## Summary of the Pull Request
The big border solution for implementing the spotlight mode is gpu consuming, switch to a resource friendly implementation.

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
prs.AIOverview:
This PR addresses GPU performance issues in the Mouse Highlighter's spotlight mode by replacing the inefficient big border approach with a resource-friendly radial gradient mask implementation. The change improves performance while maintaining the same visual effect.

- Replaces GPU-intensive border-based spotlight with composition mask brush implementation
- Adds DPI-aware feather edge calculations for consistent visual quality across displays
- Implements proper spotlight overlay management with radial gradient masking
